titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Algernon David Black Papers
titlestmt.author: Columbia University Libraries. Rare Book and Manuscript Library; machine readable finding aid created by Columbia University Libraries Digital Library Program Division

publicationstmt.publisher:
Rare Book and Manuscript Library
Columbia University Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Machine readable finding aid generated from MARC-AMC source via XSLT conversion June 26, 2009

repository.corpname: Columbia University.Rare Book and Manuscript Library,

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Writer, lecturer, and leader of the New York Society for Ethical Culture. A.D. Black died in 1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, speeches, memoranda, minutes, and publications, including radio talks and platform addresses given at the Society, the papers of several housing committees on which Black served, and autobiographical subject files compiled by Black and documenting his participation in many organizations and social causes.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Algernon David Black Papers. Rare Book and Manuscript Library. Columbia University.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is located off-site. You will need to request this material at least twenty-four (24) hours in advance to use the collection in the Rare Book and Manuscript Library reading room.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Librarian for Rare Books and Manuscripts.
